content.text:
# 2020 Outer Critics Circle Awards

}}
The 2020 Outer Critics Circle Awards announced its honorees on May 11, 2020, recognizing excellence in Broadway and Off-Broadway productions during the 2019–20 season. Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, no formal awards ceremony was held, nor did the awards name winners. Instead, the normal slate of nominees were celebrated as honorees, as Broadway and Off-Broadway had been shut down on March 12, 2020.
Despite the pandemic, with a cut-off date for the awards of March 6, over 150 productions were eligible, while the following were only eligible for new components to their productions, which were eligible in their previous runs: Girl from the North Country, Sea Wall/A Life and Slave Play.
Awards and nominations
Among the 2020 Honorees, Moulin Rouge was the most nominated production, receiving 11 nominations including Outstanding New Broadway Musical, alongside Jagged Little Pill and Tina, which received eight and five nominations, respectively. The Secret Life of Bees and The Sound Inside both received seven nominations, including Outstanding New Off-Broadway Musical and Outstanding New Broadway Play, respectively. The Inheritance and The Height of the Storm both followed closely, with five nominations each.
